intro: Cousinia odontolepis, commonly known as the toothed cousinia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant features basal leaves that are typically gray-green in color, covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Cousinia odontolepis is adapted to harsh environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
